name: Stargazer
info: A Sinner adept at wielding Magic Tools for Magic Output. Can increase Summoned Creature Damage by 10%.
maniaIntensifyText: Ultimate can be used on an existing [Victory Star], dealing [Realm of Truth] twice within range. New [Victory Star] will not be summoned at this time.
criminalRecord:
Hard to predict whereabouts. Mainly hangs around the WhiteSands. Known as the "Dangerous Stargazer" due to mixing with desert bandits and stirring up violence.

Hid the identity as a Sinner during the MBCC's bandit investigation, and maliciously hindered the investigation and intensified conflicts using her powers, seriously staking the relationship between DisCity and the nearby [[[Outland |city-states.]]]

--

The file states that the subject's awakened power enables her to read others' thoughts. Conflicts mostly arise when she bluntly expresses her crude opinions, though she never speaks maliciously on purpose.

Since her detention, the subject seems to have taken a special interest in Chief. She is mostly compliant with orders and no longer stirs up trouble.
mutationAssessment:
+++* Ability Summary

The psychic ability uses void-related mental pollutants as a medium to connect to the void and attack with the power of the void.

+++* Awakening Signs

The Stargazer claimed to have a mental breakdown when searching for her "kind" and fell into the WhiteSands. Having been accepted and saved by the Void that recognized her spirit, she crossed the Door of Void, saw the Realm of Truth, and thus awakened.

+++* Corruption State

Has moderate erosion and occasional hallucinations. The subject's unpredictable behaviors are influenced by Mania to some extent.
ecbFlavourText: "Come with me to the land of dreams..."
interrogation1: Some time after the events of Raging Sands, the Stargazer turns herself in to the MBCC because she wishes to tell the Chief a new prophecy. She reminds the Chief of her prediction that the world will end and asks them to go with her to the Realm of Truth, but they insist that as a human born in this world, they choose to die with it too -- not that they believe her prophecies. Using her cards, she foretells a journey filled with confusion and deception, ending in the Chief's death. The Chief is dismissive, but before the interrogation can continue, they are called away by an urgent request for help from the [[[Framework Against Catastrophe |FAC]]]. The [[[Broken Frontline]]] has come under attack by a well-equipped force attempting to break through into [[[BR-000]]], and high [[[M-Values |Mania]]] indicate that the attackers are either assisted by [[[Sinners |Sinner]]] or are already [[[Corruptors |Corruptor]]]. As the Chief leaves, Stargazer tells them that the prophesied journey is about to begin.
interrogation2: The Chief arrives at the Broken Frontline along with a force of MBCC officers and finds a group of FAC soldiers standing over the bodies of dead people in civilian clothes. When the Chief investigates the corpses and damage to the base's force field shield, they realize that both were caused by the same weapons, the kind wielded by gangsters rather than FAC officers. The soldiers suddenly turn on them and massacre the Chief's men; they are revealed to be [[[Outland]]] raiders who believe that the Broken Frontline's purpose is really to hide the government's supply of [[[Hypercubes |Hypercube]]], and have killed the real FAC soldiers and traded clothes. The Chief tries to convince them that breaking through the Frontline will only make their Mania worse, but they resume assaulting the shield while their leader attacks the Chief. Nearly transformed into a Corruptor, their Maniac strength nearly suffocates the Chief before Stargazer appears and rescues them. She points to these events as evidence of her prophecy, and refuses to help the Chief stop the attackers; although they point out that breaching the Frontline would cause a calamity that would kill many, Stargazer is eager to see her prophecy of the world's end come true. Still, she reminds the Chief that by [[[Shackles |Shackling]]] her, they have the power to take the future into their own hands.
interrogation3: Stargazer lays out the Chief's choices: either do nothing and die when the attackers break through the Frontline as she prophesied, or Shackle her and force her to stop them. With the barrier on the verge of collapse, the Chief knows that using the Shackles would cause them to be swallowed by the [[[DisSea]]], but this is exactly what Stargazer wants, saying it will allow them to enter the Realm of Truth together. She attempts to convince them that the world is full of falsehood, that their colleagues and companions lie to them constantly, and that they can't trust anybody in this world. Nevertheless, the Chief insists that regardless of why the Dreamflower may have chosen them, they have also been chosen to play a purpose by the people of this world. They resolve that they will overturn Stargazer's prophecy with their own hands, and as the attackers transform into Corruptors en masse, they pull their gun on Stargazer, forcing her to drop them into the mass of Corruptors.
interrogation4: Stargazer laments that when faced with a choice between truth, falsehood, and the duty they claimed to have, the Chief would end up choosing death. She turns to leave them to their fate, but is shocked to hear the sound of gunshots as the Chief fights their way out of the mass of Corruptors. The Chief shackles her and commands her to protect them, and together the two fight defeat the Corruptors, returning the roiling DisSea to its usual contained state. Stargazer is in awe that the Chief was able to overturn her prophecy, and they reach into her pocket to reveal another card: the reaper signifying death having turned into a star of hope. The Chief says that they don't know who they are or what their destiny is, but they hope that after everything comes to pass, their false body will give life to a true soul. Stargazer eagerly decides to follow the Chief to witness the moment that they discover the truth of this world.
arrestRec1: Recognizes that the Chief was extremely likely to be her "kind" that she had been searching for years. After the WhiteSands Ruins incident was resolved, the subject left vague, ambiguous messages, and escaped amidst the chaos. Detainment unsuccessful.
arrestRec2: Real name "Anarkia." Unknown parents and origin. Many different versions of the subject's childhood circulate in WhiteSands, but all are proved to be rumors.
arrestRec3: Wanders around and makes a living by fortune-telling. Never settled in a place before arriving at the oasis and let the crystal ball and the tarot determine where to go.
arrestRec4: Arrived at the oasis under the guidance of fate to look for her "kind." Under the inspiration summoning, the subject opened the ruins to seek the real and pure world by manipulating the desert bandits and beasts.
servingTerm1: Stargazer sealed all the corners in the house that could let in light and used candles instead of incandescent lights. All items were placed in an odd formation. She claimed that the mysterious and dark environment could draw her closer to "purity."
servingTerm2: Able to take out the crystal ball and tarot cards regardless of what style of clothing the subject wears. Crystal ball and tarot divination are necessary for any decision.
servingTerm3: The divination results are very convincing, despite most being undesirable results. The "guidance of fate" is listened eagerly by many Sinners and even some staff members.
servingTerm4: Teased and abetted the Chief multiple times to run away together to the real world, which was all rejected and appeased by the Chief.
emotionCheck1:
[Anarkia rubs the crystal ball.]

**Stargazer:** You're here. It has been waiting for you.

**Chief:** ......

* **Prompt:** It really has been a while since the last divination.
 * **Stargazer:** Hehe... Shall we begin the divination? My little creature.

* **Prompt:** ...Do you have to pick customers even when divining?
 * **Stargazer:** Of course. Your soul is the purest and the most mysterious.

supervision1:
++* âš  A Mysterious Fragrance

//A mysterious fragrance is sometimes present in the MBCC.//

**System Notifications:** Recently, you can often smell a mysterious fragrance in the MBCC.

* **Prompt:** Investigate

**System Notifications:** Turns out that it comes from the incense Stargazer uses daily.
supervision2:
++* âš  Divination Consultation

//Stargazer is surrounded by a big crowd.//

**System Notifications:** Sinners and staff members crowd around Stargazer, eager to have their fortunes told.

* **Prompt:** Could you tell my fortune too?
supervision3:
++* âš âš  An Arcane Prediction

//Stargazer makes a prediction about your future.//

**System Notifications:** You come across Stargazer in a corridor somewhere in the MBCC.

**Stargazer:** Hi, my little monster, would you like me to take a look at your future?

* **Prompt:** That's very nice of you.
* **Prompt:** Thanks but no thanks.

**Stargazer:** Don't be shy. Come on, hold my hand. Let's do this.

**Stargazer:** Hmm... Before you is a rising sun.

**Stargazer:** It shall shine its light on the black mirror in your hand.

**Stargazer:** On the back of the mirror are engraved words of joy and sorrow.

**Stargazer:** The destination shall be revealed only when the boundary between reality and fantasy is crossed.

* **Prompt:** I didn't understand a word.
 
**Stargazer:** Hehe, it's all right. One day you will, my beloved little monster.
supervision4:
++* âš âš  Great Dancer, Low Score

//Stargazer seems addicted to dancing on the arcade machine in the recreation area.//

**System Notifications:** You see Stargazer dancing away on an arcade machine, surrounded by a small group of Sinners and staff members.

**System Notifications:** Her movements are graceful and unearthly, capable of stopping any passersby at their tracks.

* **Prompt:** Watch with the others

**System Notifications:** She moves in perfect sync with the music but almost never steps on the right arrows on the dance platform.

**System Notifications:** The music ends, and she gets the lowest grade.

**System Notifications:** But she is met with a prolonged round of applause nevertheless.
supervision5:
++* âš âš âš  Color of the Soul

//Stargazer wishes to see the color of your soul.//

**Stargazer:** Ah, Chief, my little monster, you're finally here!

**System Notifications:** Stargazer is sitting quietly in a corner of the Darkroom, as if she has been waiting for you.

* **Prompt:** Express surprise

**Chief:** How did you know I'd come here?

**Stargazer:** Need I remind you that I'm a stargazer? Looking into the future is my area of expertise.

**System Notifications:** Stargazer brings her face close to yours, as she usually does when she meets you. As she does so, your sense of smell is titillated by an otherworldly fragrance.

**Stargazer:** Um, let me see... Today, your soul is light purple, like the twilight in the WhiteSands, like the moonlight reflected off the scale of a snake.

* **Prompt:** Express doubts
 * **Chief:** You said my soul was sky blue yesterday...
 * **System Notifications:** Stargazer presses a finger against your lips.
 * **Stargazer:** Sh! Don't be so cheeky, my little monster. //You can't step in the same river twice.// You must have heard of that, right? Similarly, the color of a soul varies from day to day.
 * **Stargazer:** Now, stop doubting everything.
 * **Stargazer:** We'll meet again sometime tomorrow. I hope the color of your soul will be as pure as it is now.

* **Prompt:** Choose to believe
 * **Stargazer:** Hehe, looks like you do care about the color of your soul, Chief.
 * **System Notifications:** Stargazer reaches out her hand to give your hair a gentle tug.
 * **Stargazer:** We'll continue tomorrow then.
 * **Stargazer:** I'll wait for you in a certain place at a certain time.
supervision6:
++* âš âš âš  WhiteSands White Fox

//Stargazer tells you a story that circulated in her tribe.//

**System Notifications:** Stargazer goes up to you in the greenhouse, where you've been tending the flowers.

**Stargazer:** Chief, nice to see you again. Have you heard about the legend of the WhiteSands white fox?

* **Prompt:** I don't think I have. Tell me about it.

**Stargazer:** This is how it goes. A traveler gets lost in the WhiteSands and is running out of water and food.

**Stargazer:** Then he comes across a white fox, which says it'd like to let him eat its flesh to help him get out of the desert.

**Chief:** Then?

**Stargazer:** Now as to what happens next... What do you think, Chief? Do you think the traveler eats the white fox?

* **Prompt:** Yes
 * **Stargazer:** That's right. The traveler gives in to his desire to live, eats the white fox, and gets out of the desert.
 * **Stargazer:** Years later, he becomes a ringleader in some city, tainted by sins and stuck in the path he's chosen.
 * **Stargazer:** He eventually realizes that what he ate that day in the WhiteSands was, in fact, the kindness left in his soul.

* **Prompt:** No
 * **Stargazer:** That's right. The traveler checks his craving and even shares his remaining water and food with the white fox.
 * **Stargazer:** His thinking is, since there is no chance of him getting out, he might as well share them with the white fox.
 * **Stargazer:** The traveler is never heard of again. But an immortal white fox appears in the desert and gives directions to those who've become lost.
baseVoicelines: [Obtain the Sinner] I never hesitate to step towards a companion... Take me with you, my little monster. [Raise to Phase 1] How I wish to see what has become of my soul now. [Raise to Phase 3] Seeing me like this, what do you have on your mind now? I wish to hear it from you... [Level Start] I've already seen through you. Save your futile struggle and surrender... [Win Battles] Upright Chariot. I knew the victory would be ours. [Lose Battles] Well, accidents happen in battles... It can't be helped... [Ultimate Skill] I will read your mind and everything else... I will see through your soul! [Die in Battles] At long last... my soul is freed... [Greeting] According to the crystal, I'll be the first person you see today... [Conversation 1] The white desert is like a pure dreamland where immaculate flowers bloom... [Conversation 2] You seem to be really fond of my ability... Do you want to have your fortune read? Relax, whatever you want to know... I have an answer for you... [Conversation 3] Never ask where they're from. Never ask they'll go. Those are my rules of fortune-telling... Well, unless I answer those questions first... [Special Conversation 1] The souls from the Black Ring possess true and pure beauty. They are not ugly at all. On the contrary, those humans who confine themselves... don't you think they look more ridiculous? [Special Conversation 2] I hear that you're looking into my past? Why don't you just ask me? Hmm... Which version do you want to hear? [Special Conversation 3] I have visited the realm of truth in my dreams. I hope that... one day, you will appear there as well. [Full Compliance] Now, I can take off all the disguises and show you my truest self... Hmm, what is it? All I did was lose a few pieces of clothing... are you shy? [Idle] Shh... I'm communicating with the souls. [Annoyed] Are you satisfied with physical touch alone? Why don't you let me teach you... how to embrace each other's soul? [Special Attention] You give me so much attention... Wanna run away with me, my dear little monster? [Dispatch] Hmm, is it the land of truth and purity before us? [Dispatch Complete] I feel most at ease around you. [Level Up] The true form of the soul is so elusive, yet so fascinating... [Pat Head] Ha, that's exactly how those novice fortune-tellers touch the crystal ball.
attireVoicelines1:
[Attire Obtained]
Finder of the legendary magic lamp of WhiteSands, you've summoned me. As a reward, I can grant you a wish.

[Greeting]
Poor lamb, have you lost your way in the desert? Fret not... Just follow me.

[Ordinary Contact 1]
Those who share the water of life under WhiteSands' moon will meet again on the other side. Emm... You gaze... Do you want to raise a glass with me?

[Ordinary Contact 2]
Charming her prey with her tame and lovely appearance. Luring them with their desires into her trap. Taking a fatal bite into the veins. I'm only talking about this adorable sandcat.

[Idle] 
How many nights have passed already?

[Annoyed]
A heedless stroke at the cat's tail may come with consequences...

[Special Attention] 
As long as you stay by my side forever, I can grant you... any wish.

[Level Up}
These kitties quite enjoy your petting.
nightmareTalent: All allied summoned creatures gain a 15% Max HP boost and a 10% damage boost.

exclusiveCrimebrand.name: Dreamland
exclusiveCrimebrand.description: New exclusive Ultimate [Dreamland]. Stargazer leads the [Victory Stars] on the battlefield, dealing (60%/70%/80% of Attack Damage) Magic Damage to enemies within the 3x3 squares around herself and all her [Victory Stars]. [Dreamland] lasts for 8 seconds. Any action taken during the effect will interrupt it. [Dreamland] can only be used once per battle.
exclusiveCrimebrand.flavourText: "Come with me to the land of dreams..."

maniaIntensify.title: Rising Star
maniaIntensify.text: Ultimate can be used on an existing [Victory Star], dealing damage from [Realm of Truth] twice within range. New [Victory Star] will not be summoned at this time.

guide.title: Summary
guide.text:
Path to Nowhere's very first Event banner Sinner. Magic summoner unit that can summon up to 2 balls that deal Magic Damage in a 3x3 at intervals. 
 
 If using as an amper, you can focus solely on levelling her third ability.

guide.title: Stargazer's Struggles
guide.text: Stargazer's personal damage is on the mediocre side and she is simply not fit for many maps due to her summons taking up spaces where Sinners can stand, while also being targettable and squishy. You also cannot move her balls after they're summoned. The only way to reposition them is by Ulting again which will replace the first ball you summoned, or you just have to wait for the ball to die and disappear. Her balls also only attack once every 4 seconds and this cannot be affected by Atkspd buffs. It also does not attack when it is summoned, meaning you have to wait 4 seconds after Ulting for the ball's first attack... Ulting an exisiting ball will make it deal damage twice and... that's all. Stargazer's ECB Ult damage also does not count as Summon Damage, thus does not benefit from Summoned Creature Dmg Up buffs.

guide.title: Stargazer's P1 Bug
guide.text: Stargazer's P1 buff actually applies to ALL summons, not just Stargazer's, meaning Stargazer actually has a place with EEE in long battles.

cons: Balls are squishy and targeted by enemies

crimebrandSets.name: Servant + City + Creation
crimebrandSets.note: Generates energy and increases summon damage.

crimebrandSets.name: Homecoming
crimebrandSets.note: Increases stats of all allied summons. Equip on Stargazer as a support set.

crimebrandSets.name: Syndicate: Glory
crimebrandSets.note: A cheap alternative for if you have no other option.

shackles.title: Honorable
shackles.description: [Victory Star] gains a 20% Attack bonus after 10 seconds on the field.

shackles.title: False Words
shackles.description: Stargazer recovers 5 energy when [Victory Star] disappears.

skills.name: Celestial Phenomenon
skills.description: The Stargazer channels Energy through her magic weapon, dealing (Attack*71%) Magic Damage each time.

skills.name: Victory Star
skills.description:
Stargazer summons a [Victory Star] on the target grid. Up to 2 [Victory Stars] can exist at a time.

[Victory Star]: Each star has 30% of Stargazer's Max HP and 100% of her Attack Damage. A star deals (130% of Attack Damage) Magic Damage every certain period of time to enemies in a 3x3 square around it.

skills.name: Astral Guidance
skills.description: When a [Victory Star] deals damage to the same enemy multiple times in a short time, damage dealt to that enemy by all [Victory Star] is increased by 4%. The effect can stack up to 5 times.

upgrade.description: Victory Star: Additional damage increased to $0%.

skills.name: Realm of Truth
skills.description: When a [Victory Star] disappears, it deals (200% of Stargazer's Attack) Magic Damage to all enemies within a 3x3 square around it.

upgrade.description: Victory Star's damage when it disappears is increased to $0%.

compliance: Unlock File: Performance in Serving Terms, Attack +6
Unlock Voice: Special Conversation 1, Attack +6, Unlock Requirements: Dispatch Stargazer 2 times
Unlock File: Performance in Serving Term
Unlock Voice: Special Conversation 3, Unlock Requirements: Complete Stargazer's Review
Unlock File: Performance in Serving Terms, Emoticons
Unlocking Data: Monitoring Records, Unlock Voice: Full Obedience, Unlock Sinner Title: your and my prophecy poems
